intro: Ruschia connata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. It has succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. Ruschia connata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth and vibrant floral display.
